attributes.value: Neustreet Journal - Issue #3
Undervalued Cristiano Ronaldo Cards, Off-White x Nike's Summer Collab, and the $11.8M CryptoPunk
‚öΩÔ∏è Euros 2021 and The Soccer Trading Card Opportunity

Right now, people all over the world are watching the UEFA European Championship of soccer, better known as 'The Euros.' With games hosted in several countries across Europe, some of the world's best teams such as France, Spain, Germany, and England will be competing in a tournament from June 11 to July 11. The Euros occur every four years and the last competition in 2016 was watched by 2 Billion people on live television.

We all know that soccer is the most popular and widely played sport in the world, but what about the soccer trading card market? In the US, sports like baseball, basketball, and football command much more attention and their cards sell at higher prices.

And yet, there is clearly some exciting growth around soccer cards. In eBay's 2021 report "State of the Trading Cards" the company notes that sales of the soccer trading card category grew by 1586% last year, much more than any other sport. If you listen to sports cards podcasts, you'll note that the hosts are getting more and more listener questions asking them about soccer cards.

While not comparable to other sports in the US, there is still an active soccer card market. For example, a rookie card of 20-year-old Norwegian player Erling Haaland recently sold for $125,000. Haaland is considered a soccer prodigy with huge potential, much like LeBron James when he joined the NBA.
üêê Cristiano Ronaldo vs. LeBron James:

We took a look at two case studies - Cristiano Ronaldo and LeBron James. Both athletes are considered the very best in their respective sports, have similar ages and accomplishments, and are expected to leave legacies as two of the greatest ever.
We reviewed a few different metrics that demonstrate their global reach and their market value/commercial relevance:
- Ronaldo has 300 Million Instagram followers, over 3x more than LeBron's 88 Million Instagram followers.
- Ronaldo's annual salary last year was $120 Million, around 25% more than LeBron's $96.5 Million.
Then we took a look at two comparable cards from the athletes:
- Cristiano Ronaldo 2003 Panini Sports PSA 10 card
- LeBron James 2003 Topps Chrome PSA 10 card

These were both sold earlier this year at a similar time. The most recent Ronaldo card sold for $197,000 and the most recent LeBron card sold for $461,000. The LeBron card was sold at a price more than 2x higher than the Ronaldo card.
üìä Are Soccer Trading Cards Underpriced? We Think They Are

Most card collectors are American and soccer has a long way to go before having the same level of cultural relevance as other American sports. American soccer will still grow as we can see happening in the MLS and with the US co-hosting the 2026 World Cup with Canada and Mexico.

Meanwhile, we can expect that the hobby of card collecting will continue to grow around the world, lighting a fire under all the soccer fans looking to buy cards of their favorite players. And for hundreds of millions of people around the world, that favorite player is Ronaldo.

This past Tuesday, Cristiano Ronaldo scored in the Portugal vs. Hungary match at the Euros, adding a new record to his already legendary career - highest all-time goal scorer for the Euros. Full disclosure: as our team watched this match and did the analysis above on the underpriced soccer market, we actually decided to buy a Ronaldo card!
üëÄ The Latest in Collectibles News
